subject: Politics
title: Marxism Explained
description: A quick, practical guide to Marxism Explained.

hook.text: Marx didn't just criticize capitalism. He built a complete theory of history, economics, and revolution.

buildup.text: Historical materialism says economics drives everything. The ruling class controls production and ideology.

discovery.text: Marx predicted capitalism would collapse from its own contradictions â€” inequality, crises, and worker revolt.

twist.text: Capitalism adapted instead. Labor laws, welfare states, and consumer culture defused revolutionary pressure.

climax.text: Marxism inspired revolutions but none matched Marx's predictions. Revolutions came in poor countries, not rich ones.

punchline.text: Marx diagnosed capitalism's flaws. His cure turned out worse than the disease.

quiz.question: What does historical materialism argue?
options: Economics drives history and the ruling class controls production and ideology
Great leaders drive history through individual choices
Religion is the primary force shaping societies
